description: Blend of multiple +‎ universe, coined by American philosopher William James. Surface analysis: multi- +‎ -verse

entries.meaning: (philosophy) The world, considered as lacking in purpose, design, or predictability.
(physics, cosmology) The hypothetical group of all the possible universes in existence.
examples: Our universe is a very small part of the multiverse.

entries.meaning: (fiction) The different canons, continuities or timelines of a fictional property, considered as a whole.
examples: In the DC multiverse, our reality is called "Earth-33". But in the Marvel multiverse, it's "Earth-1218".
